com.ctk150230.markov

Class valueIteration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ctk150230.markov.valueIteration

  • class valueIteration
extends java.lang.Object

    Value Iteration

    This class computes the J* values and the optimal policies at each time division for each state in the system and stores them in a custom data structure jValueNode. The jValueNode for each time and state pair is stored in an ArrayList accessed by the time division which returns a LinkedHashMap accessed by the stateName value.
    Since:
    2017-10-15
    Author:
    Charles Krol
    See Also:
    stateNode, ArrayList, LinkedHashMap

      Constructor and Description
      valueIteration(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,stateNode> stateM, int iterations, int states, int actions, double discount)
      Constructor which initializes all fields After initializing the fields it loads LinkedHashMaps into the jValues ArrayList Then the J* Values for the first time division are copied over to the jValues List Then the J* Values for the rest of the time divisions are calculated and entered into the ArrayList

        valueIteration(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,stateNode> stateM,

               double discount)
        Constructor which initializes all fields After initializing the fields it loads LinkedHashMaps into the jValues ArrayList Then the J* Values for the first time division are copied over to the jValues List Then the J* Values for the rest of the time divisions are calculated and entered into the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        stateM - the LinkedHashMap containing all states and data
        iterations - the number of iterations for the value iteration algorithm
        states - the number of states in the MDP
        actions - the number of actions in the MDP
        discount - the discount factor ùõÑ

    • Method Detail

      • calculateFirstJValues

        private void calculateFirstJValues()
        Copies over each state's rewards to the jValues Map into the first time division

      • calculateRestJValues

        private void calculateRestJValues()
        Calculates the J values for each state at the rest of the time divisions

      • bestFirstAction

        private jValueNode bestFirstAction(stateNode currentState)
        Calculate the best action at time = 1 for a given state based on the reward of the next state Not used in calculation of current state's J Value, just picking the best next action
        Parameters:
        currentState - the current state we are in
        Returns:
        a jValueNode for the next based state based only on it's rewards alone

      • maxAction

        private jValueNode maxAction(int iterationNumber,
                             stateNode currentState)
        Calculates the J values for each action and determines the best action to take at each state. They action name and the J Value are entered into a jValueNode and returned to the calling method which will copy the node into the jValues List
        Parameters:
        iterationNumber - the current iteration number, used to grab the previous iteration's J Value
        currentState - the current node processing used to get the reward as well as the stateName to pull the appropriate J Value out of the jValues List
        Returns:
        a jValueNode containing the name of the best action to take on this state at the current time division as well as the total reward gained from taking the action at this state

      • getjValues

        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,jValueNode>> getjValues()
        Getter to return the calculated jValues list for output to console in the main class
        Returns:
        jValues ArrayList
